home.description: Upload, view, edit, and analyze Excel files directly in your browser.
home.uploadDescription: Upload an Excel file to begin analyzing your data. No server required - everything happens in your browser.
home.uploadEditDescription: Upload Excel files and edit them directly in your browser. Add or remove rows and columns, modify values, and download the updated file.
home.analyzeDescription: Perform sensitivity analysis to see how changes in variables affect outcomes. Visualize results with interactive charts.
home.correlateDescription: Discover relationships between your variables with correlation analysis. Understand how data points relate to each other.
home.fileLoadedDescription: Your Excel file has been loaded. Use the navigation menu to explore different analysis options.

settings.title: Settings
settings.aboutDescription: This is a client-side data analysis tool that allows you to upload, view, edit, and analyze Excel files directly in your browser.
settings.dataPrivacy: All processing happens in your browser - no data is sent to any server.

howToUseSteps.step1: Upload an Excel file using the Data Viewer
howToUseSteps.step2: Navigate between different analysis screens using the navigation bar
howToUseSteps.step3: Modify your data as needed and save the updated file
howToUseSteps.step4: Perform various analyses on your data

settings.settingsSaved: All settings are saved in your browser's local storage.

dataViewer.title: Data Viewer
dataViewer.dragAndDrop: Drag and drop your Excel file here, or click to select

sensitivityAnalysis.title: Sensitivity Analysis
sensitivityAnalysis.supplierColumnDescription: Select column that identifies suppliers (any column can be used)
sensitivityAnalysis.targetCategoryDescription: Select the category whose weight you want to optimize
sensitivityAnalysis.optimizationDescription: Choose whether to maximize (increase) or minimize (decrease) the target category's weight

alternativeMethods.title: Weighted Supplier Evaluation Methods
alternativeMethods.euclideanResults: Euclidean Distance Results - Weighted Supplier Ranking

supplierRanking.euclidean: Supplier Ranking by Euclidean Distance Method

alternativeMethods.rankChangeDescription: * Rank Change: Positive numbers (green) indicate improved ranking compared to weighted average, negative numbers (red) indicate worse ranking

topsis.title: Explanation of TOPSIS Method
topsis.description: TOPSIS (Technique for Order of Preference by Similarity to Ideal Solution) evaluates alternatives based on their similarity to an ideal solution and dissimilarity to a negative-ideal solution.
topsis.point2: The ideal supplier would have a score of 1.0
topsis.point3: The overall score is calculated as a weighted average of all criteria scores

euclidean.title: Explanation of Euclidean Distance Method
euclidean.description: Euclidean Distance measures how far each supplier is from an ideal point in a multi-dimensional space where each dimension represents a criterion.
euclidean.point1: Lower distances indicate better performance (closer to ideal)
euclidean.point2: Higher scores (derived from distances) indicate better performance
euclidean.point3: The overall score is calculated as a weighted average of all criteria scores

earlyDetection.title: Early Detection System
earlyDetection.description: Identify potential issues before they become critical by predicting future supplier performance using Exponential Smoothing.
earlyDetection.instructions: Select time and supplier columns along with the categories to analyze. The system will predict future values based on historical trends.
earlyDetection.timeColumnDescription: Column representing the time period (years, quarters, etc.)
earlyDetection.categoryDescription: Select the categories to analyze (Quality, Logistics, etc.)
earlyDetection.alphaDescription: Higher values give more weight to recent observations (0.4 recommended)
